short_description: Discover Chile, a long, narrow South American nation stretching from the Atacama Desert to Patagonia. Experience world-class wine regions, stunning Andean landscapes, vibrant cities like Santiago, and the diverse natural beauty of this Pacific coast country.

health.tap_water_safety: Safe to drink in major cities
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, supermarkets, and shops
Chile is famous for its wine production, particularly in the Central Valley

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though service charge may be included
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Chile has diverse climates ranging from desert in the north to Mediterranean in the center and sub-Antarctic in the south. The country experiences distinct seasons, with weather varying significantly by region due to its length.

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm temperatures perfect for exploring cities, visiting wine regions, and beach activities. Ideal time to visit Santiago, Valpara√≠so, and the Atacama Desert. Great for outdoor adventures and Patagonia

when_to_visit.title: Spring & Autumn
when_to_visit.time_period: September to November, March to May
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild and pleasant temperatures with beautiful seasonal colors. Perfect for sightseeing, exploring cities, wine tours, and hiking. Great time to visit without the summer crowds

when_to_visit.title: Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Cooler temperatures, especially in the south. Perfect for skiing in the Andes and winter sports. Northern regions like the Atacama Desert remain dry and pleasant. Great time for wine regions

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Chile depends on the region: visit during summer (December to February) for Patagonia and beaches, or during spring and autumn for wine regions and cities. Winter (June to August) is ideal for skiing in the Andes
